content: Paid for aand downloaded but the game wouldn't load. Just froze my phone on the title screen. I finally gave up and uninstalled. It sucks cause this game looks awesome. Super disappointing.
Very fun! Obviously inspired by Slay the Spire, but not really derivitive. Needs more content, but kept me busy for two weeks.
Nice twist on STS, great repeat playability

Does not work with dragon touch max 10. Not sure why. The game will slowly load up and then crashes to desktop. I should have tried it out when I bought it. Grrr. My error in not trying it out quick enough.
Excellent StS type game with its own unique take. Good job dev. Very fluid and battery friendly. I like it a lot. Trump's up!

Great fun with tons of replayability. You will probably lose your first few games as you learn about which card synergies are best, but soon you'll find yourself tearing through baddies! Note to the dev; Win and Loss numbers in History are broken. They do not display the correct amounts.
Doesn't work on Samsung galaxy s10, couldn't change the language, text is missing. The lower portion of the screen is cut off.
Great game!. However, I'd appreciate larger fonts and a way of zooming the cards. It's hard to play on a 5'5" screen. Despite these issues, I definitely recommend it.
Great game. I own it on Steam but even better on the phone. This is a fun mechanic and a great indie game. I hope everyone gives it a chance

Blood Card is a rouge-like deck builder in a similar vein to Slay the Spire, but has a number of things that set it apart from other like titles. In Blood Card, your deck is your life, so playing cards and drawing cause you to "take damage", this also means that you heal after every battle. Having the final boss (Death) following you through the encounters is an interesting twist. If you like monster slayers, STS, Darkest Dungeon, you maybe like this.
Very fun game. Deckbuilding roguelike, it's like Slay the Spire, but with a twist: your deck is your life. Very interesting mechanically.
